review: I have a media server in my home and do a lot of local streaming.  From the start I have had a lot of Roku devices since they were really the only thing available and capable of doing what I needed.  As time went on these newer devices started to come out.  Until the fire I had not considered switching, I purchased a Fire TV from the Bestbuy in my area because I was to impatient to wait for the two day shipping.  Anyhow I got the device plugged it in and set it up, I noticed right off that it was much faster than all of my roku devices including the Roku 3 that I had gotten not to long before.  It is very responsive and works well with different apps.  I do have an amazon prime account and it works great for streaming content from the web, I use Plex to stream content in the house and the Fire did this much faster than the Roku.  There are no load times at the beginning of the movies like I had with the Roku, among many other aspects.  If I had the money I would get rid of all my Roku devices and replace them with the Amazon Fire TV.  I am not saying this to bash on Roku, they have great products.  But in the end the Fire TV beat all of their products that I had in my home.
author: Landin
